title: font of author name on numerous Stephen King titles; this is "Bag of Bones"
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140331085942im_/http:/typophile.com/files/SKfontID_5069.jpg)

I'm totally new at this, but my guess is some kind of Garamond. I don't mind being wrong! :) Please be as specific as possible.

Also, if the K requires a specific variation for that tail, please advise.
author: WeaselADAPT

comments.content: Could be wrong but to me it looks like [Garamond](http://web.archive.org/web/20140331085942/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/garamond) with a customized /K.

After spending a bit of time on

[http://www.garamond.culture.fr/en/page/comparing\_typefaces](http://web.archive.org/web/20140331085942/http:/www.garamond.culture.fr/en/page/comparing_typefaces "http://www.garamond.culture.fr/en/page/comparing\_typefaces")

I'm feeling like it's probably closest to Granjon LT. Would you concur?

I suspect the letters were then probably all slightly "fixed" when given the embossing look...
